question: Capital generally refers to the amount invested in an enterprise by its owners.
An agreement is not necessary to form a partnership.
A list of all account names used to record transactions of a company is referred to as a T-account.
For a business partnership there must be a written agreement between two or more legally competent persons.
A partnership must be operated for the purpose of earning a profit.
There are certain tax advantages to a partnership primarily because a partnership is taxed as a separate entity.
A corporation is considered a separate taxable entity, so its income is taxed to the corporation and again to the stockholders when distributed by the corporation.
A transaction is an event which can be expressed in terms of money and which brings change in the financial position of a business enterprise.
Revenue, expense, and withdrawals accounts are called nominal accounts.
A limited partnership exists when one or more of the partners have limited their liability for partnership debts to the amount of assets they have contributed to the partnership.
Once a transaction is recorded in the journal, it is necessary to post it immediately in the ledger accounts.
A limited partner may not participate in the management of the business.
Posting is the process of recording journal entries in the journal.
In a limited partnership, one or more of the partners must be a limited partner.
Normally, every partner act as an agent for the partnership and for every other partner.
Unlimited liability means that, every partner can act as an agent for every other partner.
Financial accounting serves external decision-makers, such as stockholders, suppliers, banks and government agencies.
A partnership is easier and less costly to establish than a corporation.
A capital interest in a partnership is a personal asset of the individual partner that cannot be sold or disposed of.
It may be more difficult for a corporation to raise capital than it is for a partnership.
Each partner's withdrawal account is credited to record the withdrawal of assets or the payment of personal expenses.
The non-cash assets and liabilities are recorded at their fair value.
The use of book value provides a more equitable measure of the amount invested by each partner.
Partnerships are most common in comparatively small businesses.
Existing partners can prevent the sale of a partnership interest by one partner to another individual.
